subject: Law
title: Offer and Acceptance
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Offer and Acceptance.

hook.text: You say 'I'll sell my car for $5,000.' Your friend says 'Deal.' A contract just formed in two seconds.

buildup.text: An offer is a clear proposal to enter a contract. Acceptance is unconditional agreement to those terms.

discovery.text: The offer must be definite enough that a court can determine the terms. Vague promises don't count.

twist.text: A counteroffer kills the original offer. Saying 'I'll pay $4,000' is a rejection, not acceptance.

climax.text: Under the mailbox rule, acceptance is effective when sentâ€”not when the offeror receives it.

punchline.text: One side proposes. The other agrees. That's the spark.

quiz.question: What happens when you make a counteroffer?
